column4: hello, can anyone tell me how I could reinstall 'at'?  I had a problem and followed a bug report that said to remove it and re-install.  When I try to apt-get install at, I get: E: Package at has no installation candidate
can you show me the bug report that says re-install at
so I removed it, then tried to reinstall, but I get that error
what command do you use to remove it
try installing anacron and cron packages
I've just found it in the repo
yes, but when I try to install it "apt-get install at" I get the error: Package at is not available, but is referred to by another package.
what version of ubuntu are you using
I can't explain it as I can see the package fine
maybe I'm missing the repo in my sources.list?
can you tell me what repo it should be in?
can I find a http link to a .deb for 'at' somehow?
